WorkItem.Description:
Hello ,
I was trying to use getHighestRow() to get the last row of my excel sheet  but it appears to pick up some row slightly above it. Is there a limit to the no. of rows this command can browse. Im refering to a 9000 row excel sheet on which im trying to use phpexcel to import latest added products.
Thanks

Comments.Message: There is no logical reason why getHighestRow() should return a lower row number than that containing the last content in the worksheet; typically people complain about the converse, because it returns the highest row number that contains anything, whether style settings or images or merges or print settings or named ranges or whatever, even if it doesn't contain any actual data
Can you try it out and tell me what and why it happens?
Ive attached the file if you notice.
I echoed the getHighestRow() , it showed 8679 whereas the highest row is 8790.
